intro: Gagea ebulbillosa, commonly known as the bulbous gagea, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Liliaceae and is characterized by its small, grass-like leaves and clusters of delicate, bell-shaped flowers. The plant produces bulbs that serve as its primary storage organs, allowing it to survive in temperate climates. Gagea ebulbillosa typically blooms in early spring, adding a subtle floral display to woodland and meadow habitats. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in plant morphology and ecological adaptation.
